properties.title: Rendez-vouz in the Park(let)
properties.description: Snuggled in between NE 61st and 62nd Street in Little Haiti are two small pieces of public property ideal for parklet conversion. The street is heavily trafficked by local pedestrians as it is a busy intersection for access to Notre Dame and the Little Haiti Soccer Field. Moreover, it is also a central bus stop for the 9, 10, 62, and 202 which heavily service the neighborhood.  The project would include providing additional benches, shade trees, and decorative trash cans, as well as general beautification through sustainable and easily manageable, native landscaping. This space is ideal because people already congregate in the area waiting for busses and will allow for expansion of usable public property.
properties.details: This parklet would be designed to provide a permanent public place for passersby to sit and relax under the shade and enjoy the atmosphere of Little Haiti around them. It will be strategically designed to provide additional, comfortable seating to wait for busses, but also benches/tables to sit and chat with other locals offering the possibility of vibrant activities and community conversations. Given the congested nature of this space, the parklet also has additional benefits such as adding more space for people to walk.

properties.title: North Miami K-9 Facility  and Community Park
properties.description: The NMPD seeks to redevelop Oleander Park located at 12100 NW 13 Avenue. As an underutilized public park, the Department would like to convert the space into a multi-use park with four main components: a K-9 Training Facility for North Miami PD and surrounding agency K-9 units; a Tot-lot; a mini-dog park; and a community garden.  These lush green spaces fully engage the community in a safe place and allow police officers, residents, and children to interact with each other in a positive way.
properties.details: Enhancing an often forgotten park and segment of the City, increases the residents pride and interaction within their neighborhood. The K-9 Facility allows for visibility and consistent interaction by the officers within the community. With virtually no separation, aside from fencing, between the officers and the community, relationships and trust will be forged at the footsteps of their homes. Children along with their families and animals, have a fully integrated space  to enjoy  outdoor activities. The organic synergy of the space continues in the community garden; planted and harvested by the residents and the officers. This rehabilitated space is a living classroom breading hope for an engaged, active, and healthy community.

properties.title: More jazz for more people
properties.description: We will bring the successful model of Jazz in the Gables lunchtime jazz concerts to the community in and around the Jackson Healthcare complex.
properties.details: Our lunchtime jazz concerts (more than 60 successfully produced on the plaza of the Coral Gables Museum) are a free respite in the workday for people to relax, eat lunch, and be entertained with high-quality music.

properties.title: Tribute to Overtown's Musical History, Late Late Shows
properties.description:
In Miami's early days when black performers came to town and played on Miami Beach, they had to be back on the mainland before curfew at 12 midnight. They would go to Overtown and perform for the residents of Overtown, usually with out charging or being paid, at local venues or even on the street. 

I propose pop up performances in various venues and street corners that bring the music back and educate today's Miami residents about the rich musical legacies that graced our city in its early days using today's local performers.
properties.details: Miami is often portrayed as not having an identify of culture and history. So many that live here do not know of the hidden gems and therefore they lack a "sense of place". Children, in particular, would benefit from learning of what their neighborhoods have been, while enriching the experience with performances that resonate with today's artistic aesthetic.

properties.title: Newt Miami: Experiments in Light, Color & Sound (“NEWT”)
properties.description: Redesign the Miami skyline with NEWT, an art & sound installation to temporarily replace the dancing silhouette on the InterContinental's 19-story digital canvas in Fall 2015. Inspired by Isaac Newton's theory that each primary color correlates to a note on the musical scale, we designed a series of dynamic projections to play on the hotel's wall in synchrony with an original composition streamed live online.  For 5 days everyone will have access to this sensorial narrative from public lookout points throughout the city.  NEWT uses everyday technology to celebrate public art, augmented architecture & transmedia. NEWT will also come alive through compelling programming, including thematic events & activations in local spaces in the district.
properties.details: NEWT will broaden exposure to contemporary art, technology and performative architecture.  The art experience is immersive, sensorial & reflective.  People will be taken on an emotional journey designed to tap specific visual and audio cues through color, light and sound; and will also be mobilized to explore related events, panel discussions and activations taking place in the area.  Based on themes of color and sound; public art and augmented architecture; Downtown Miami’s role in the city’s cultural identity; and the intersection between technology and art, NEWT's programming will enlighten younger and newer audiences. NEWT appeals to audiences across gender, language, race, education, socio-economic status and arts sensitivities.

properties.title: Homestead Air Reserve Park (HARP) Discgolf Courses
properties.description: The Homestead Air Reserve Park is the perfect location for enjoying the great South Florida outdoors.  The open fields and beautiful trees lend themselves to the wonderful game of Discgolf.  The park is already properly maintained and is mostly used by a few folks for walking and jogging, leaving this land mostly empty.  The improvement will be found by giving this park purpose and appeal.  The area is growing fast .  The park is large enough to accommodate more than one 18 'hole' course plus some practice areas. Discgolf is low-cost to build and maintain since all the equipment is rugged and intended for prolonged outdoor use.
properties.details: This idea will help improve the quality of life of an area that this growing  fast and thirsting for activities.  Discgolf is low-cost to enjoy, is playable by people of all ages and is played throughout the world.  Travelers are already attracted to the Keys, Biscayne National Park, Everglades, etc.  This could be one more stop or the jumping off point for outdoor fun.  People from everywhere will have another great reason to head to South Florida!

properties.title: Top Them Off
properties.description: To construct lively and innovative bus shelters that will bring attention to the lack of bus shelters throughout Miami-Dade. Today, over 2,000 bus stops across the county are uncovered. Transit-dependent commuters must endure Miami’s torrential downpours and heat just to get to work or school and back.  We will design and construct bus shelters at key locations using a design consistent with each neighborhood’s style, and that addresses the challenges limiting the construction of shelters, such as limited space. Each shelter will have a call-to-action for the public to submit their own design solutions.
properties.details: Feel comfortable and safe while waiting for their bus, while enhancing the eccentric beauty of Miami-Dade. This project will facilitate the installation of much needed shelters by tapping into the public’s breadth of expertise and creativity, and expediting the design process. It will also inform potential advertisers of the value of investing in public bus shelters. We will draw attention to the needs of transit-dependent commuters, and publicize a virtual charrette where citizens can provide feedback on the design and special amenities of future bus shelters.

properties.title: Walking a poem is discovering - poetry in the crosswalk
properties.description: Hundreds of students cross the intersection on Miller/SW 56 Street and SW 162 Avenue on weekdays to go to John A. Ferguson High School while thousands more drive down this major corridor weekly. Let's change the streetscape and activate this space not only with public art but also with famous lines of poetry in the crosswalk! I want to have a contest at Ferguson High School and have the students submit their favorite lines of poetry. The top voted lines of poetry will be incorporated into the surrounding crosswalks. As Robert Frost said, "I have never started a poem yet whose end I knew. Writing a poem is discovering." I want to create a memorable place for all residents; walking through a poem is discovering, too.
properties.details: I want to add poetry in our crosswalks so that people can experience something more than what our streets currently offer-- sidewalks, medians, street lamps, roadways. We have residents who walk, jog, run, rollerblade and bike and they should be able to experience art and poetry as other areas do in Miami-Dade County. When residents walk from one neighborhood to the next, they should have a memorable and discovering experience. This project would create and activate this corridor.

properties.title: Metromover Parkway
properties.description: This space runs from NE 1st St to NE 4th St under the Metromover.  The idea is to formalize and improve the existing path, provide elements to make it more welcoming.  Add simple easy to maintain and pleasant landscaping.  Add doggie bag holders so dog walkers can clean up after their pups.
properties.details: Enjoy an area that is currently blighted, by making the space open and welcoming.  Formalizing a space that is currently used as a dog walking space.

properties.title: Nature Trail Community Park
properties.description: The idea is to expand the El Portal Nature Trail by taking down a fence that separates the trail from Horace Mann Middle School and work with the District to take over an additional 40 by 600 feet of seldom used field space.  This expansion would convert this trail from a 15,000 square foot space, to a community park of almost 40,000 square feet. The trail would be extended into the new area to create a loop with outdoor exercise equipment, water refill station and tree ID signs. Currently, the trail is dilapidated, seldom used and includes several invasive tree species. The expanded park would include a reflection area where students and residents of all ages could come to experience the sounds of nature in this unique oasis.
properties.details: So that the community can come together to walk, run, exercise with the equipment or just sit and contemplate nature.  It would be a place of learning about native plants and animals where parents could bring their kids to enjoy the outdoors. It would make Miami better with a creative solution to expanding and enhancing our green spaces in a cost-effective way that can be replicated in other municipalities.  Combining the City resources with that of the school district, we can achieve a beautiful greenspace that benefits everyone in the area.  The inclusion of a reflection area is a great place for neighbors to sit and talk while relaxing on benches under the trees.  The increase in activity would refocus attention on this community space.

properties.title: DRAWBRIDGE PROJECTIONS: Thoughts on Water
properties.details:
This proposal would allow the public to reflect upon a unified theme, and soften a moment of tension for traffic within the city fabric. The drawbridges are in place because of water, and have the potential to be used as a stage to celebrate it!

*Haiku (俳句 high-koo) are short poems with a simple text structure that capture a fleeting moment, feeling, or image. They are often inspired by natural elements or the surrounding urban environment, and can reflect both humor and emotion.
properties.description:
The Miami River is a significant artery for the city. With ships frequently passing, vehicular traffic, cyclists, and pedestrians alike, must yield to the rhythms of the opening bridges. These vertical surfaces are untapped canvases for creative urban works.

As a way to make an engaging experience for those waiting to cross the Miami River, I propose to project haiku* on the vertical faces of the Brickell avenue bridge each time it opens in the evening. These visual short texts would be submitted by the public through an online platform, and explore the subject of water.

Drawbridge Projections would utilize an existing infrastructural element in the heart of the city, and transform it into a dynamic community-generated art project.

properties.submitter_name: AGORASCAPE (Rudolf Uhlemann, Suhey Rojas, Ana Faria Delfino, Zin Htet Chan)
properties.title: Garden for Healing
properties.description: Transform underutilized outdoor green space in the Jackson Memorial Hospital Campus into a healing garden.
properties.details:
...rejuvenate from their daily stresses. Patients, specially, need a space of refuge outside of the hospital to escape their daily health stresses. Several studies have proven that patients with access to nature will heal faster than those without access to nature. The Jackson Memorial Hospital campus is undesirably urban and devoid of green space. A quiet space of refuge, where one’s senses are completely immersed in nature is desperately needed. The garden will be designed for patients, but will also be used and appreciated by patient families, hospital staff and the public.

This will be a collaboration between Landscape Architects and University of Miami Medical Students.

properties.title: FoodSpark: Miami – Creative Gatherings Connecting Miamians via Food & Conversation!
properties.description: The formula for ‘FoodSpark: Miami’ (FSM) is simple in concept: Public Space + Art + Music + Miami Residents + Food + Conversation. This idea - inspired by an initiative that began in St. Louis, MO last year - is for a monthly event creating spaces open to the public, where diverse groups of people can come together to bond over food & topics of discussion they care about. FSM would also incorporate visual/performance art & music. To launch FSM, we envision starting in a place easily accessible by mass transit and centrally located within Miami-Dade County, such as Museum Park. From there, FSM would partner with organizations in various neighborhoods, and travel to different locations each month in order to reach as many people as possible.
properties.details: Miami-Dade County is known for being home to a diverse population of individuals who represent a myriad of racial and ethnic backgrounds; however, too often our diverse community tends to live and work in silos, making it difficult to regularly interact with one another in meaningful ways. ‘FoodSpark: Miami’ (FSM) is about providing more opportunities for the people of greater Miami to connect in a fun way they wouldn’t usually be able to in public places. Each month, FSM will provide another space fostering new relationships between residents who may have never met each other, as well as cultivating ideas to bridge our culturally-rich neighborhoods together despite our geographic separation.

properties.title: Wynwood Greenhouse is an innovative outdoor destination intersecting art, architecture and nature.
properties.description: Residents need a green space to bring their families to 365 days a year, whether it is to picnic, sit enjoy nature, spot butterflies or birds or enjoy free community programming.  The Greenhouse is an all-in-one solution to all of these needs.   Our goal is for people to connect with nature and enjoy the elements of earth, wind, water and sun.  We realize shade is a valuable commodity.Our solution for shade is innovative and sustainable. We will use photovoltaic (solar) panels in a decorative pattern on the roof to provide shade for park-goers while using clean sustainable energy technology, and to draw upon the planet’s most plentiful and widely distributed renewable energy source: the sun.
properties.details: We want people to enjoy the space, and feel happy and healthy in this outdoor oasis.  The solar panels will provide shade near the 50-foot stage, so the audience can enjoy performances in the day and night.  We will program the Park with diverse free content including music concerts, artsy events, yoga, and green discussions for kids, families and adults of every generation. It is critical we offer shade to avoid the dangerous effects of sunburn and as a measure for their experience to be cool and enjoyable, especially in the summer months. We hope people will learn more about sustainable energy solutions, and become inspired to bring this to their homes, businesses and communities.

properties.title: GrooveMiami
properties.submitter_name: Matt Mawhinney, Alissa Farina, Milda Bublys, Christine Zavesky, Tracey Jackson
properties.description: Starting with the rooftop of the Miami-Dade College parking garage, GrooveMiami is a series of multi-style, group dance classes. GrooveMiami will repurpose locations like the MDC parking garage through hour to hour and a half guided mini-classes in styles including salsa, swing, line dancing, and disco yoga for a cool down!
properties.details: Get out, move, and groove! GrooveMiami will help people to come together and reap the health benefits of an hour to an hour and a half of moderate-intensity cardiovascular exercise. And, by targeting multiple public spaces across Miami-Dade ranging from the roof top of the Miami-Dade College parking garage downtown to Metrorail stops to public parks, GrooveMiami also hopes to broaden participants' understanding of how and to what ends public space can be used.

properties.title: Bunche Park Community Collaboratory
properties.details: Our team  would love to work w/ the City of Miami Gardens in transforming this relatively under-utilized public space in Bunche Park into a cutting-edge cultural innovation hub where  highly acclaimed educators & health professionals, business leaders, and professional designers and artists from around the world could partner WITH  residents of Miami Gardens in order to develop and implement truly innovative inter-cultural, inter-generational,  interactive cultural arts outreach programs and projects in order to cultivate a healthier, more civically engaged and socially-conscious urban neighborhood. This particular project would serve as a pilot community project for several other cultural collaboratories to be created in the United States.
properties.description: Currently, there are several acres of parking lots/grassy spaces located directly outside the North Dade Health Center & the Miami Gardens Neighborhood Enrichment Center located at 16405/165555 NW 25th Avenue in the Bunche Park neighborhood of Miami Gardens. Very little $$ would be required  to upgrade this easily accessible area into a vibrant public space which may function as a  parking lot for the community centers during the day (M-F 9-5), but would be a cool pop-up  cultural hub after hours and on wknds when the health/community centers are closed to the public. Examples of improving the space would be to work with our urban design/landscape architecture team to  provide better lighting,  install more public seating/tables, etc.

properties.title: Vibe 305 Public Garden and Hot Spot -- Let's Make Connections!
properties.submitter_name: Partnership between Trinity Cathedral and Empowered Youth
properties.description:
To jumpstart the Vibe305 Café to support Empowered Youth! Currently, the county is leasing this property to EY to expand their successful Vibe 305 food truck concept into a fully operational café.  Currently the land is sitting empty and represents one of the last green spaces in Wynwood. 

We would like to set up an outdoor garden and picnic space with wifi access for anyone in the neighborhood that would provide some shade, some rest, and a space to connect - both on the web and with each other. 

Everything supported by this effort is already part of the final café design - and who knows? the food truck may stop by to serve lunch!

Costs: $2,500-electricity + wifi; $3,000- landscaping + furniture; $1,000-gravel; $2,000-labor
properties.details:
Change lives.  Simply stated, creating jobs for our inner-city youth transforms and saves lives. 

This project will create an outdoor public green space in Wynwood and it will serve as a link between the 'new creative' class of Miami that is rapidly growing around Wynwood and Midtown and the young urban youth who are have yet to connect to the 'new' Miami. 

The Vibe 305 Cafe will be a training kitchen for our young men and present them with certification in the culinary basics. They will get their on-the-job training and work experience on the Vibe 305 food truck or in the Vibe 305 Cafe.  hey will learn a work ethic, responsibility, accountability, and customer relations skills. They will leave our program ready for success.

properties.title: NW 18th Ave -- Making Connections Project
properties.description: A small neighborhood park should become a gathering place for inter-generational activities. The informal adult  gathering place is situated on a distressed commercial corridor where children from two elementary schools pass by everyday. The park needs to become a more formal gathering where children and adults are able to use free wifi internet access. The park should also become a catalyst for creating more green space in the area.
properties.details:
use the park as a place to improve the aesthetic look and feel of the neighborhood, increase interactions between adults and children in the community; spur redevelopment along the commercial corridor and link the schools to the community in a positive way.
Additional we would like to use a near by building a a small community arts center that would attract local artist to the community and provide opportunities for children to learn history, art and culture on a safe space.
